meanings.def: used when you are not certain that something will happen or that something is true or is a correct number
examples: Maybe he'll come, maybe he won't.
‘Are you going to sell your house?’ ‘Maybe.’
Is she right? Maybe, maybe not.
Maybe it will do me some good to go for a run.
It will cost two, maybe three hundred pounds.
We go there maybe once or twice a month.
There are two sides to every story, maybe even more in this case.
I thought maybe we could go together.
Maybe we can meet for lunch next week sometime.
I've just got a new laptop, so maybe you can use my old one.

meanings.def: used when replying to a question or an idea, especially when you are not sure whether to agree or disagree
examples: ‘Am I nervous? Well, maybe just a little.’
‘You should stop work when you have the baby.’ ‘Maybe, but I can't afford to.’

meanings.def: something that is only a possibility and is not certain to happen or succeed
examples: These are all maybes—there is no certainty.
I don't want any ifs, buts or maybes.
That is the difference between the superstars and the maybes.
